greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array T read by rows: T(n,k) = number of partitions of n into distinct parts, the greatest being k, for k=1,2,...,n.
comment: Conjecture: A199918(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} (-1)^(n-k) T(n,k). - _George Beck_, Jan 13 2019
link: Henry Bottomley, Partition calculators using java applets
Index entries for sequences related to partitions
formula: T(n, k) = coefficient of x^n in x^k*Product_{i=1..k-1} (1+x^i). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 07 2003
maple: for i from 1 to p do
# now have a partition t2 of n into distinct parts
for n from 1 to 12 do lprint(f2(n)); od: # _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 09 2018
xref: If seen as a square array then transpose of A070936 and visible form of A053632. Central diagonal and those to the right of center are A000009 as are row sums.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
